page.title: 17Transport in the area
page.content: Launceston is quite a busy market town. The main A38 bypasses the town and 298 cars per hour on average use the by-pass near Launceston. 151 cars per hour leave or enter the town. Public transport is scarce in the area,but a bus service is regularly used by schoolchildren. Because of the lack of railway here all goods have to be transported into the town by lorries.The roads are narrow but have been widened to take the heavy goods,but much of the area is covered by narrow country lanes. In Lawhitton 29 were counted using the village's roads,this figure included farm machinery.In general the state of the roads was very poor,with many roads needing some repair.
